summary: The Associated Press (AP) is an American non-profit news agency based in New York City, founded in 1846. It works like a cooperative, providing news to its members and major U.S. media. Since 1917, AP has won 59 Pulitzer Prizes. It's known for its AP Stylebook, sports polls, and election coverage. By 2016, AP news was used by over 1,300 outlets worldwide. It has 235 news bureaus in 94 countries, publishing in three languages. AP also runs a radio network with regular newscasts and sportscasts. Many non-U.S. media pay to use AP's content.
title: Associated Press
